channel.title: Black Mesa is released!
channel.description:
It's been a long time coming, and we had a rough start this morning, but it's out in the wild! Black Mesa is released! If you are having trouble with our mirrors on the main site, try the torrent, and help us seed!
More than anything, SPREAD THE WORD! We are giving this all away to the community, but the best payment we can possibly get is that we get as many people to download and play this game as possible! HELP US PROMOTE IT, EVERYWHERE!
Thanks guys! Today is a good day!

item.title: Black Mesa is released!
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
It WAS serving a place for discussion, but I can now see that it is less than useful and even though you know it’s already been released I can see why people might get overly excited by seeing new posts in this thread (honestly, you don’t think we’d make a new one to announce the next release?).

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is released!
item.dc:creator: sourcegamer101
item.description:
Deathmonkey7:

Came to the forum, saw new posts in a thread called “Black Mesa is Released!”, got super excited for a couple of seconds.
God dammit, it’s a necro thread.

Exact same thing happened to me when the dude below me necro’d it. Can a moderator please lock this thread so nobody gets false-alarmed?

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is released!
item.dc:creator: Painkiller
item.description:
Unclejeeves:

Just downloaded it. Can´t friggin wait for my gal to fall asleep. Late night headcrab flinching FTW!!!

LOL…I remember being with a girl like that. Now, I’m lucky enough to have a wife that doesn’t mind me gaming on my laptop in the same room. She watches her shows: I put on the cans, and fire up the games!

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is released!
item.dc:creator: Phaota
item.description:
MFHRaptor:

Why didn’t anybody post an update on Source SDK 2013 running Black Mesa Mod?

This will be my first time to play Half-Life series starting from the very beginning. That’s because I’ve been waiting for this Mod for so long since I heard about it in 2011.

Now as I’m about to start downloading it via Steam I heard about the 2013 single-player version of Source Engine. So… did anybody test it? Does it work without problems, or should I stick to 2007 version?

There wasn’t a need to post anything since it didn’t affect the game in any way. If plays perfectly. I’ve already been though the game several times so far, even posted a bunch of excellent desktop imagery and anaglyphic 3D versions of most over in my moddb.com image gallery. You won’t have any issues as long as you graphics card is strong enough and your drivers are up-to-date.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is released!
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
I was about to say something to that effect. I regularly check the Greenlight pages to see if they’ve released it. Sadly this is not the case.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is released!
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
MFHRaptor:

Now as I’m about to start downloading it via Steam I heard about the 2013 single-player version of Source Engine. So… did anybody test it? Does it work without problems, or should I stick to 2007 version?

Stick to the 2007 base, the 2013 base won’t have the content that BM has to mount.

And just as a clarification, you mean download just the SDK base, right? Because BM isn’t on steam yet.

Read full topic

Don’t search for the SDK 2007 Base on Steam. Go to you Steam Library > tools tab and it’ll be in there.

obs: i was tryng to find and download the source sdk 2007 on steam, but i cant find it. Is that because the new one is out? i have to download the 2013 now?

thaks to anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is released!
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
It is not the complete engine that you get as a Source licensee. It it still basically Source Mod SDK but they now host it on Github. Don’t get your hopes up. You still need the Source SDK Base stuff installed from Steam to run games (this includes the binaries like hl2.exe and a host of DLLs containing engine code that you don’t get to tinker with). The Mod SDK lets you build your own server.dll and client.dll. That’s it!

Read full topic
